summary.span: 为内容元素提供 WPF 核心级基类。

span.span: Provides a WPF core-level base class for content elements.

summary.span: 内容元素设计用于流样式显示，它们使用面向标记的直观布局模型和精心设计的简单对象模型。

span.span: Content elements are designed for flow-style presentation, using an intuitive markup-oriented layout model and a deliberately simple object model.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 定义以下内容的共同特征： defines the following common content characteristics: - 输入：所有派生的类提供了从键盘、 鼠标、 拖放操作、 触笔控件和加速器的基本输入捕获的支持。Input: All derived classes provide support for basic input capture from keyboard, mouse, drag-and-drop operations, stylus controls, and accelerators. - 聚焦：所有派生的类都能够获得焦点。Focus: All derived classes are potentially focusable. (但是的默认可获得焦点状态基类是`false`。(However, the default focusable state for the base class is `false`. 有关详细信息，如何使可获得焦点，请参阅。)此外，此类包含[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]，您可将用于在相关的元素中遍历焦点。For details on how to make a focusable, see .) In addition, this class contains [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] that you can use for traversing the focus across related elements. - 事件：包括事件的输入和焦点相关的; 它还包括在状态中的更改的事件。Events: includes events that are related to input and focus; it also includes events for changes in state. 在许多情况下，事件也是路由的事件。In many cases, the events are routed events. 在某些情况下，路由的事件具有隧道和浮升路由策略，为不同的相同状态或条件的响应中的事件引发。In some cases, routed events have both tunneling and bubbling routing strategies, raised as separate events in response to the same state or condition. 此外，定义[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]可引发路由事件，可以添加或删除事件处理程序。Also, defines [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] that can raise routed events and that can add or remove handlers to events. 共享许多公共[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]与。 shares many common [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] with . 这些常见[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]不是来自共享的类继承。These common [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] do not come from a shared class inheritance. 它们共享公共命名、 类似的行为和类似的内部实现的但[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]在每个类。But they do share common naming, similar behavior, and similar internal implementation of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] in each class. 相似性是因为和是每个类的基元素，不过每个都有不同的意图对其标记对象模型的行为。The similarity is because and are each classes that are an element base, although each has different intentions for its markup object model behavior. 具体而言，递减自，它提供低级别图形支持的呈现复合窗口中的矩形区域而延迟呈现，以便详细的概念更轻松地支持对文档的情况下，例如流和换行，通用的。In particular, descends from , which provides the lower-level graphics support for rendering a to a rectangular region within a composited window, whereas defers rendering so that concepts more common to document scenarios, such as flow and wrapping, are more easily supported. 这两个相关类还实现公共接口和。These two related classes also implement the common interfaces and . ## 继承者说明Notes to inheritors 类尚未定义流样式显示的完整内容元素的所有方面。The class does not yet define all aspects of a complete content element for flow-style presentation. 是一个直接派生的类。 is an immediately derived class of . 包含一组更完整的其他成员以支持呈现内容主机和使用 WPF 框架级别的布局系统中。 includes a more complete set of additional members that support rendering a within a content host and using the WPF framework-level layout system.

summary.span: 为指定的路由事件添加路由事件处理程序，并将该处理程序添加到当前元素的处理程序集合中。

span.span: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以将相同事件的同一处理程序添加多个时间并且不会引发异常。You can add the same handler for the same event multiple times without raising an exception. 但是，实际调用处理程序处理该事件时的多个时间。However, the handler is actually invoked multiple times when the event is handled. 因此，请考虑此行为可能应该在处理程序实现中考虑的副作用。Therefore, consider how this behavior might have side effects that should be accounted for in your handler implementation. 通常使用此方法提供的"添加"访问器实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]事件的自定义的路由事件的访问模式。You typically use this method to provide the implementation of the "add" accessor for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] event access pattern of a custom routed event.

param.span: 如果为 ，则将按以下方式注册处理程序：即使路由事件在其事件数据中标记为已处理，也会调用处理程序；如果为 ，则使用默认条件注册处理程序，即当路由事件被标记为已处理时，将不调用处理程序。

The default is .

summary.span: 为指定的路由事件添加路由事件处理程序，并将该处理程序添加到当前元素的处理程序集合中。

span.span: Adds a routed event handler for a specified routed event, adding the handler to the handler collection on the current element.

summary.span: 将 指定为 ，可为已标记为由事件路由中的其他元素处理的路由事件调用所提供的处理程序。

span.span: Specify as to have the provided handler be invoked for routed event that had already been marked as handled by another element along the event route.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 以实用方式处理低级别的输入的事件是一个复杂的任务。Processing low-level input events in a practical way is a complex task. 许多控件实现其中某个事件被标记为已处理，并且另一个更直观的事件会被替换的行为。Many controls implement behavior where a certain event is marked as handled, and is replaced by another more intuitive event. 通常情况下，控件将仅标记平台输入的事件，为已处理是否存在某个设计意图要求执行此操作。Generally, a control will only mark a platform input event as handled if there is some design intention for doing so. 在某些情况下，这些设计意图可能不是在特定输入事件的处理要求。In certain scenarios, those design intentions might not be what your particular handling of the input event requires. 它对于这种情况是该注册处理程序替换`handledEventsToo`作为`true`适用。It is for these scenarios that registering handlers with `handledEventsToo` as `true` is appropriate. 但不是应定期执行此。But you should not do this routinely. 调用以响应所有事件处理程序，即使处理将增加你自己的应用程序事件处理逻辑的复杂性。Invoking handlers in response to all events even if handled will complicate your own application event processing logic. 如果是巨大的处理程序逻辑，可能会降低性能。You may see a decrease in performance if the handler logic is substantial. 你应保留附加的已处理事件的情况下，您已经发现在开发过程中的某些控件正在处理你仍想要使用的应用程序逻辑来处理的事件处理程序的使用。You should reserve the use of attaching handlers for already-handled events for situations where you have already discovered during the development process that certain controls are handling events that you still want to handle with application logic. 避免处理的某些事件控件组合的行为的类的另一种方法是使用该事件的预览替代方法。Another technique for avoiding the class handling behavior of certain event-control combinations is to use that event's preview alternative. 例如，如果标记为已处理类处理，您可以为添加处理程序相反。For example, if is marked handled by class handling, you might be able to add handlers for instead. 可以将相同事件的同一处理程序添加多个时间并且不会引发异常。You can add the same handler for the same event multiple times without raising an exception. 但是，实际调用处理程序处理该事件时的多个时间。However, the handler is actually invoked multiple times when the event is handled. 因此，请考虑此行为可能应该在处理程序实现中考虑的副作用。Therefore, consider how this behavior might have side effects that should be accounted for in your handler implementation. 通常使用此方法提供的"添加"访问器实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)]事件的自定义的路由事件的访问模式。You typically use this method to provide the implementation of the "add" accessor for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] event access pattern of a custom routed event. ## Examples 下面的示例实现一个处理程序上调用将定义处理程序附加到一个页面使用的命名元素的页面上的事件`handledEventsToo` `true`。The following example implements a handler invoked on the event on a page that attaches a defined handler to one of the named elements on the page using `handledEventsToo` `true`. 将调用此处理程序，即使路由中的另一个元素标记为已处理到达路由中的处理元素之前的共享的事件数据。This handler would be invoked even if another element along the route marked the shared event data as handled before reaching the handling element in the route. [!code-csharp[EventOvwSupport#AddHandlerHandledToo](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/EventOvwSupport/CSharp/page2.xaml.cs#addhandlerhandledtoo)] [!code-vb[EventOvwSupport#AddHandlerHandledToo](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/EventOvwSupport/visualbasic/page2.xaml.vb#addhandlerhandledtoo)]

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示此元素能否用作拖放操作的目标。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this element can be used as the target of a drag-and-drop operation.

span.span: if this element can be used as the target of a drag-and-drop operation; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 拖放操作默认情况下，不启用，必须通过设置有意启用到`true`。Drag-and-drop operations are not enabled by default, and must be enabled deliberately by setting to `true`. 除了此基本设置，拖放行为则完全是特定于实现的并且不由或任何其他基元素类。Beyond this basic setting, drag-and-drop behavior is entirely implementation specific and is not defined by or any other base element class. 例如，某些控件，默认行为，但不会有派生的类具有这样的行为。Certain controls, for example, , do have a default behavior, but no derived classes have such a behavior. 拖放功能的详细信息，请参阅[拖放概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/drag-and-drop-overview.md)。For more information on drag and drop, see [Drag and Drop Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/drag-and-drop-overview.md). 重写此依赖关系属性在其实现中的元数据。 overrides the metadata for this dependency property in its implementation. 具体而言，指定此属性允许属性值继承 (是`true`元数据中)。Specifically, designates that this property allows property value inheritance ( is `true` in metadata). 在此上下文中的属性值继承意味着，如果有与任何其他值的子元素通过本地值或样式，分配 （也是在样式中，默认情况下此值与最接近的父元素的值分配值或本地值），则该父元素中的值通过属性系统分配给所有未分配的子元素。Property value inheritance in this context means that if there are child elements with no other value for assigned through local values or styles, the value of the nearest parent element with this value assigned (again, either in styles, by default values, or a local value), then the value from that parent element is assigned to all unassigned child elements by the property system. 这意味着您可以指定是否允许在根元素上的删除操作，然后传播到所有的值具有不专门为其分配的值的子元素`false`。This means that you can specify whether to allow drop operations at the root element and then propagate the value to all child elements that have not specifically assigned it a value of `false`. ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|NoneNone| ## Examples 下面的示例设置在[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)]。The following example sets in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)]. [!code-xaml[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#AllowDrop](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/CSharp/page1.xaml#allowdrop)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要从属性中删除动画，指定为该属性的标识符`dp`并指定`clock`作为`null`。To remove an animation from a property, specify the identifier for that property as `dp` and specify `clock` as `null`. 这会删除动画，动画的属性设置为其基值。This removes the animation and the animated property is set to its base value. 但是，不会停止最初关联的动画时钟。However, the originally associated animation clock is not stopped. 其他任何分配给该时钟的动画将继续运行。Any other animations assigned to that clock will continue to run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 选中属性进行动画处理，请注意，动画将开始考虑经过动画处理的非动画的起始点以外的第一帧呈现时。When you check whether a property is animated, note that the animation will begin and be considered animated when the first frame beyond the non-animated starting point is rendered. 如果有关`animation`是`null`，然后删除任何当前动画并保持的属性的当前值。If the for `animation` is `null`, then any current animations are removed and the current value of the property is held. 如果整个`animation`值是`null`、 从属性中移除所有动画和属性值会恢复为其基值。If the entire `animation` value is `null`, all animations are removed from the property and the property value reverts to its base value. 但是，不会停止最初关联的动画时间线。However, the originally associated animation timeline is not stopped. 分配给该时间线中的其他任何动画将继续运行。Any other animations assigned to that timeline will continue to run.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要捕获，必须启用一个元素。To be captured, an element must be enabled. 检查是否是`true`在调用之前。Check whether is `true` before you call . 如果调用将返回`true`，然后也是`true`。If calling returns `true`, then is also `true`. 如果调用返回`true`，然后并引发事件，与在事件数据报告为元素其中调用方法。If calling returns `true`, then the and events are raised, with in the event data reported as the element where the method is called. 如果强制捕获，您可能会妨碍现有捕获-尤其是在使用与拖放鼠标捕获。If you force capture, you might interfere with existing captures - especially with captures that relate to drag-and-drop with the mouse. 若要清除的所有元素的鼠标捕获，请调用与`element`参数作为提供`null`。To clear mouse capture from all elements, call with the `element` parameter provided as `null`. ## Examples 下面的示例捕获鼠标或释放捕获，基于由该元素是否已捕获鼠标。The following example captures the mouse or releases capture, based on whether the mouse is already captured by the element. 请注意，此示例将转换为预期的捕获目标元素到接口，并因此最初调用方法。Note that this example casts the prospective capture target element to the interface, and is thus initially calling the method. 将强制转换为是一种方法，如果您不确定是否想要使用了捕获的元素鼠标是非常有用或。Casting to is a technique that is useful if you are unsure whether the element you want to have capture the mouse is a or a . 接口 cast 和接口方法调用然后调用相应的特定于类型的 CaptureMouse 实现在内部而无需强制转换为的试用版或。The interface cast and the interface method call then calls the appropriate type-specific CaptureMouse implementation internally without requiring a trial cast to either or . 此相同的强制转换技术也适用于其他成员的定义，例如的很多与输入相关的事件和其他与输入相关的方法。This same casting technique works for other members that defines, for instance many of the input-related events, and other input-related methods. remarks.format: ## Remarks 始终根据基础默认触笔设备的默认实现返回`true`。The default implementation based on the underlying default stylus device always returns `true`. 但是，如果你要扩展提供在输入系统的设备实现的输入的设备，就可以创建的系统可能会返回不同结果的替代触笔设备实现。However, if you are extending the input devices that provide the device implementation for the input system, it is possible to create a system with an alternative stylus device implementation that might return different results. 在元素捕获触笔，它会接收触笔输入，即使在触笔位于其边界外。When an element captures the stylus, it receives stylus input even if the stylus is outside its bounds. 只有在拖放操作通常捕获触笔。The stylus is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations. 调用此方法调用一个基础的静态方法。Calling this method calls an underlying static method . 由活动触笔设备实现实现的实际捕获行为。The actual capture behavior is implemented by the active stylus device implementation. 若要捕获，必须启用一个元素。To be captured, an element must be enabled. 检查是否是`true`返回在调用之前。Check whether is `true` return before you call . 如果调用将返回`true`，也是`true`。If calling returns `true`, is also `true`.

abstract member Focus : unit -> bool override this.Focus : unit -> bool

summary.span: 尝试将焦点设置到此元素。

span.span: Attempts to set focus to this element.

returns.span: 如果键盘焦点可设定到此元素;如果此方法调用未强制焦点。

span.span: if keyboard focus could be set to this element; if this method call did not force focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可获得焦点，并都必须`true`。To be focusable, and must both be `true`. 请注意，几乎所有派生的类不是默认情况下。Note that nearly all derived classes are not by default. 即使元素是特定树中的可获得焦点并已启用，事件处理，（例如，针对复合控件） 可能会响应预览焦点事件通过不允许焦点，因此此方法将返回`false`。Even if an element is focusable and enabled, event handling within a specific tree, (such as for a composite control) might respond to the preview focus events by not allowing focus there, thus this method would return `false`. 焦点通常受两个不同的概念： 键盘焦点和逻辑焦点，并不总是相同。Focus in general is governed by two separate concepts: keyboard focus and logical focus, which are not always identical. 此方法设置逻辑焦点。This method sets the logical focus. 没有专门; 设置键盘焦点的编程方法键盘焦点取决于用户输入。There is no programmatic means to set keyboard focus specifically; keyboard focus is determined by user input. 有关详细信息，请参阅[焦点概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md)并[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)。For more information, see [Focus Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md) and [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md). 如果调用将返回`true`，并还有`true`。If calling returns `true`, and are also `true`. 如果相关的属性不是已经`true`，则在调用，按以下顺序引发一个或多个以下事件： ， （来源为新的焦点目标）， ， ，， （来源为新的焦点目标）。If the related properties are not already `true`, when you call , one or more of the following events are raised in the following order: , (source is the new focus target), , , , (source is the new focus target). ## Examples 以下示例查找指定的名为文档中的段落是页面加载的事件处理程序，并将焦点设置到它。The following example is a page-loaded event handler that finds a specified named paragraph in the document and sets focus to it. 段落不是默认设置。 可获得焦点此特定段落已应用了样式的 （未显示） 使用的样式以使其可获得焦点。Paragraphs are not focusable by default; this particular paragraph had a style applied (not shown) that used a style to make it focusable. [!code-csharp[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#Focus](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/CSharp/page1.xaml.cs#focus)] [!code-vb[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#Focus](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/visualbasic/page1.xaml.vb#focus)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有焦点的元素接收键盘输入。Only the focused element receives keyboard input. 某些派生的类可能会替代此依赖属性元数据，以便派生的类是默认情况下可获得焦点。Certain derived classes might override metadata for this dependency property such that the derived class is focusable by default. 当由继承或其派生的类，重写此依赖项属性的元数据，并将此属性才能为默认值重新定义`true`。When inherited by or its derived classes, overrides the metadata for this dependency property and redefines the default value of this property to be `true`. ### 依赖属性信息Dependency property information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|NoneNone| ## 继承者说明Notes to inheritors 从类派生时，请考虑是希望您获得焦点，因为默认情况下它将不能获得焦点的元素。When you derive from , consider whether you want your element to be focusable, because by default it will not be focusable. 如果您希望您可获得焦点的元素，重写此属性在派生的类静态构造函数中的元数据，如下所示：If you want your element to be focusable, override the metadata for this property in your derived class static constructor as follows: [!code-csharp[CorePseudocode#UIElementShortOverride](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/CSharp/corepseudocode.cs#uielementshortoverride)] [!code-vb[CorePseudocode#UIElementShortOverride](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/CorePseudocode/visualbasic/corepseudocode.vb#uielementshortoverride)] 其中`myElement`是会重写元数据值的类型的类名称。where `myElement` is the class name of the type that you are overriding the metadata value on. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一种使方式默认情况下可获得焦点并接收焦点时为其提供可视行为。The following example creates a style that makes a focusable by default and gives it a visual behavior when it receives focus. [!code-xaml[ContentElementsSmorgasbord#Focusable](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ContentElementsSmorgasbord/CSharp/page1.xaml#focusable)]

summary.span: 为此元素上的指定属性返回基属性值，忽略任何可能来自正在运行或已停止的动画的动画值。

span.span: Returns the base property value for the specified property on this element, disregarding any possible animated value from a running or stopped animation.

returns.span: 就像没有动画被附加到指定的依赖属性一样的属性值。

span.span: The property value as if no animations are attached to the specified dependency property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果没有动画附加到属性，则返回值也始终等于返回值。If no animations are attached to the property, then the return value is always identical to the return value. 如果有附加的动画，然后所有可能的动画派生值包括开始和停止值将被忽略，并根据所有其他可能的输入确定的属性值。If there are animations attached, then all possible animation derived values including the start and stop values are ignored, and the property value is determined based on all other possible inputs. 有关详细信息，请参阅[依赖属性值优先级](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md)。For more information, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时将返回一种替代方法[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)]父此元素，如果不存在可视父级。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的默认虚拟实现返回`null`。The default virtual implementation of this method returns `null`. 提供了实际的实现。 provides a practical implementation. 替代父级的用于事件路由，在其中元素创建的替代父结构以便将其事件路由有何区别路由到标准的父级，在可视树的标准模式的方式的情况下或在向下预览路由策略。Alternative parents are used for event routing, in cases where an element creates an alternative parent structure so that its events are routed in a way that diverges from the standard pattern of routing up the visual tree to the standard parent, or downward in the preview routing strategy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件允许拖动事件，可以修改鼠标指针的外观，以便为用户可视反馈提供拖放操作期间的源。The event allows the source of a drag event to modify the appearance of the mouse pointer in order to give the user visual feedback during a drag-and-drop operation. 视觉反馈用于强调拖放操作正在进行。The visual feedback reinforces that a drag-and-drop operation is in process. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

summary.span: 在此元素获得逻辑焦点时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element gets logical focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果焦点有意强制使用方法调用，但前一个键盘焦点位于不同的作用域将与键盘焦点不同逻辑焦点。Logical focus differs from keyboard focus if focus is deliberately forced by using a method call but the previous keyboard focus exists in a different scope. 在此方案中，键盘焦点将保持其所在位置和元素其中方法称为仍获得逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus remains where it is and the element where a method is called still gets logical focus. 此事件的更精确地解释是它时引发的值路由中元素的属性有所不同`false`到`true`。A more precise interpretation of this event is that it is raised when the value of the property of an element in the route is changed from `false` to `true`. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为接收焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that receives focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际获得焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that gained focus. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有相应的隧道事件。There is no corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一个类似的事件，跟踪中维护一个元素; 的焦点状态的属性的状态更改中许多相同的情况下引发事件。 is a similar event that tracks status changes in a property that maintains the focus state for an element; the event is raised in many of the same circumstances. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为具有焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that has focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际具有焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that has focus. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在此元素捕获鼠标时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element captures the mouse.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在元素捕获鼠标，它会接收鼠标输入，即使在鼠标指针位于其边界外。When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the mouse pointer is outside its bounds. 鼠标通常仅在拖放操作期间捕获和保持捕获，直到发生拖放操作。The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations and remains captured until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为具有捕获的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that has capture might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查在事件数据，以确定实际元素具有鼠标捕获。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that has mouse capture. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有定义相应的隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 输入的绑定支持命令来输入设备的绑定。Input bindings support the binding of commands to input devices. 例如，实现的输入包括特定于鼠标设备的属性的绑定。For example, implements input bindings that include properties that are specific to mouse devices. 输入绑定的集合包括适用于类型的输入的绑定和还声明的实例的输入的绑定。The collection of input bindings includes both input bindings that pertain to the type and also input bindings that are declared on the instance. 相关的属性， ，维护命令绑定的集合。A related property, , maintains a collection of command bindings. 这些绑定不同于输入绑定，因为它们表示下一级别的命令处理为其绑定到已知的命令和特定于的类处理程序的操作。These bindings differ from input bindings in that they represent the next level down of command processing - actions that are tied to known commands and class-specific handlers for them. ## XAML 属性元素用法XAML Property Element Usage ``` ``` ## XAML 值XAML Values *oneOrMoreInputBindings**oneOrMoreInputBindings* 一个或多个元素 (通常或派生类)。One or more elements (typically the or derived classes). 其中每项功能都必须具有和属性设置。Each of these is expected to have a and attribute set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果应用程序具有多个焦点部门，如菜单的内容和应用程序的其余部分之间，可能与键盘焦点不同逻辑焦点。Logical focus might differ from keyboard focus if an application has multiple focus divisions, such as between menu contents and the remainder of the application. 在此方案中，键盘焦点仅可对应用程序 UI 中的一个元素，但是，其他焦点分支中的某些元素仍可能会保留逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus can only be on one element of the application UI, however, certain elements in other focus divisions might still retain logical focus. 有关逻辑焦点的详细信息，请参阅[输入概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md)并[焦点概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md)。For more information on logical focus, see [Input Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/input-overview.md) and [Focus Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/focus-overview.md). ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|NoneNone| ## Examples 下面的示例创建一种使方式默认情况下可获得焦点并接收焦点时为其提供可视行为。The following example creates a style that makes a focusable by default and gives it a visual behavior when it receives focus. summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示在考虑元素组合的情况下，鼠标指针的位置是否与命中测试结果相对应。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 与不同，此属性才是`true`与命中测试如果将鼠标指针位于 literal 元素-。Unlike , this property is only `true` if the mouse pointer is over the literal element - as it is for a hit test. 而如果鼠标指针位于子元素上，特别是对所包含的元素的更深层的模板和组合的情况下，元素，此属性将为`false`。If the mouse pointer is instead over a child element, in particular over elements that are part of an element's deeper template and compositing, this property will be `false`. 除非你知道如何控件的组合 （例如，使用此属性在自定义控件模板中定义的控件），此属性可能返回意外的结果。Unless you know how a control is composited (for example, you use this property in a custom control template for a control that you define), this property might return unexpected results. 对于大多数情况下不创作控件的情况，请使用相反。For most scenarios where you are not authoring controls, use instead. 如果此元素捕获鼠标，并且此属性是`true`在捕获时，此属性将继续返回`true`直到失去鼠标捕获，并且指针不是其边界上。If the mouse is captured by this element, and this property is `true` at time of capture, this property will continue to return `true` until mouse capture is lost and the pointer is not over its bounds. ## 依赖项属性信息Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |元数据属性设置为 `true`Metadata properties set to `true`|NoneNone|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 密钥处理与其他平台功能，例如命令和文本组合进行交互。Key handling interacts with other platform features such as commanding and text composition. 事件是一个较低级别的文本输入的事件，可能不会像预期某些控件上。The event is a lower-level text input event that might not behave as expected on certain controls. 这是文本的因为某些控件具有控件组合或提供更高级版本的类处理输入处理和相关的事件。This is because some controls have control compositing or class handling that provides a higher-level version of text input handling and related events. 此事件创建一个别名附加的此类事件，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

Public Shared ReadOnly KeyDownEvent As RoutedEvent

summary.span: 在此元素丢失逻辑焦点时发生。

span.span: Occurs when this element loses logical focus.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果有意通过某个方法调用强制失去了焦点，而前一个键盘焦点位于不同的范围内，则逻辑焦点将与键盘焦点不同。Logical focus differs from keyboard focus if focus is deliberately forced away by using a method call but the previous keyboard focus exists in a different scope. 在此方案，其中是键盘焦点将保留和元素其中方法称为仍获得逻辑焦点。In this scenario, keyboard focus remains where it is, and the element where a method is called still gets logical focus. 此事件的更精确地解释是它时引发的值路由中的元素的属性从更改`true`到`false`。A more precise interpretation of this event is that it is raised when the value of the property of an element in the route changes from `true` to `false`. 由于此事件使用冒泡路由，因此失去焦点的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that loses focus might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据以确定实际获得焦点的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that gained focus. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有相应的隧道事件。There is no corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在元素捕获鼠标，它会接收鼠标输入，即使在指针位于其边界外。When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the pointer is outside its bounds. 只有在拖放操作通常捕获鼠标。The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations. 此事件使用冒泡路由，因为丢失捕获的元素可能是而不是元素的子元素实际附加事件处理程序。Because this event uses bubbling routing, the element that loses capture might be a child element instead of the element where the event handler is actually attached. 检查事件数据来确定实际失去捕获的元素中。Check the in the event data to determine the actual element that lost capture. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 没有定义相应的隧道事件。There is no defined corresponding tunneling event. - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在指针位于此元素上并且按下任意鼠标按钮时发生。

span.span: Occurs when any mouse button is pressed while the pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. 任意一个协同通常引发事件或，对应于一个两个标准鼠标按钮按下。The event is often raised together with either or , which correspond to a press of one of the two standard mouse buttons. 并也是路由的事件，但它们是直接路由的事件，并引发相应的特定于按钮的事件时事件到达事件路由中的此元素。 and are also routed events, but they are direct routed events, and the appropriate button-specific event is raised when the event reaches this element along the event route. 请参阅备注或。See Remarks for or . > [!IMPORTANT] > 少量派生的类具有类似控件的行为，例如， ，可能会具有固有的鼠标按钮事件处理的类。A few derived classes that have control-like behavior, for example, , might have inherent class handling for mouse button events. 鼠标左键按下事件是最有可能的事件，以便使类处理在控件中。The left mouse button down event is the most likely event to have class handling in a control. 类通常处理标记基础为已处理的类事件。The class handling often marks the underlying class event as handled. 一旦该事件标记为已处理，其他实例处理程序附加到该元素通常不会引发。Once the event is marked handled, other instance handlers that are attached to that element are not ordinarily raised. 通常也不会引发的任何其他类或实例处理程序附加到针对 UI 树的根节点的浮升方向中的元素。Any other class or instance handlers that are attached to elements in the bubbling direction towards the root in the UI tree are also not ordinarily raised. 您可以解决的问题，在前面的重要说明中所述和仍接收鼠标左键按下具有类处理通过使用这些解决方案的派生类上的事件的事件：You can resolve the issue that is outlined in the preceding Important and still receive events for left mouse button down events on a derived class that has class handling by using either of these solutions: - 附加处理程序未标记为已由控件处理的事件。Attach handlers for the event, which is not marked as handled by the controls. 请注意，由于这是预览事件，该路由从根开始，隧道下行控件。Notice that because this is a preview event, the route starts at the root and tunnels down to the control. - 虽然通过调用注册该控件上的处理程序，然后选择使处理程序以侦听事件，即使它们已标记为已处理路由的事件数据中的签名选项。Register a handler on the control procedurally by calling and choosing the signature option that enables handlers to listen for events even if they are already marked as handled in the routed event data. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 在鼠标指针进入此元素的边界时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)，它使用直接事件处理路由策略。 is a [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) that uses the direct event handling routing strategy. 直接路由的事件不会引发在路由过程;相反，它们被处理的同一元素中引发位置。Direct routed events are not raised along a route; instead, they are handled in the same element where they are raised. 但是，它们启用了路由的事件的行为，如在样式中的事件触发的其他方面。However, they do enable other aspects of routed event behavior, such as event triggers in styles. 尽管跟踪当鼠标指针进入元素，此事件的多个边界确切地报告属性值已从`false`到`true`此元素上。Although tracks when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of an element, this event more literally reports that the property value has changed from `false` to `true` on this element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Custom Event MouseLeftButtonDown As MouseButtonEventHandler

summary.span: 在鼠标指针位于此元素上并且按下鼠标左键时发生。

span.span: Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 尽管这[路由事件概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md)似乎按照浮升路由通过元素树，它实际上是引发并由每个重新沿元素树的直接路由的事件。Although this [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md) seems to follow a bubbling route through an element tree, it actually is a direct routed event that is raised and reraised along the element tree by each . 此事件是一个报告基础的鼠标按钮具体情况的多个相关事件事件，它是由在事件路由的每个元素处理附加的事件。This event is one of several related events that report the mouse-button specifics of an underlying event, which is an attached event that is processed by each element along an event route. 此事件的基础参数公开事件。The arguments of this event expose the arguments of the underlying event. 如果该事件被标记为已处理事件路由过程，则仍会引发鼠标按钮特定事件;但是，必须通过显式调用添加的鼠标按钮特定事件的处理程序，使用选项来处理已标记为已处理的事件，以便将该事件的侦听器。If that event is marked as handled along the event route, the mouse-button specific events are still raised; however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . > [!IMPORTANT] > 少量派生的类具有类似控件的行为，例如， ，可能会具有固有的鼠标按钮事件处理的类。A few derived classes that have control-like behavior, for example, , might have inherent class handling for mouse button events. 鼠标左键按下事件是最有可能的事件，以便使类处理在控件中。The left mouse button down event is the most likely event to have class handling in a control. 类通常处理标记基础为已处理的类事件。The class handling often marks the underlying class event as handled. 一旦该事件标记为已处理，其他实例处理程序附加到该元素通常不会引发。Once the event is marked handled, other instance handlers that are attached to that element are not ordinarily raised. 通常也不会引发的任何其他类或实例处理程序附加到针对 UI 树的根节点的浮升方向中的元素。Any other class or instance handlers that are attached to elements in the bubbling direction towards the root in the UI tree are also not ordinarily raised. 您可以解决的问题，在前面的重要说明中所述和仍接收鼠标左键按下具有类处理通过使用这些解决方案的派生类上的事件的事件：You can resolve the issue that is outlined in the preceding Important and still receive events for left mouse button down events on a derived class that has class handling by using either of these solutions: - 附加处理程序未标记为已由控件处理的事件。Attach handlers for the event, which is not marked as handled by the controls. 请注意，由于这是预览事件，该路由从根开始，隧道下行控件。Notice that because this is a preview event, the route starts at the root and tunnels down to the control. - 虽然通过调用注册该控件上的处理程序，然后选择使处理程序以侦听事件，即使它们已标记为已处理路由的事件数据中的签名选项。Register a handler on the control procedurally by calling and choosing the signature option that enables handlers to listen for events even if they are already marked as handled in the routed event data. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.RoutedEvent MouseLeftButtonDownEvent
Public Shared ReadOnly MouseLeftButtonDownEvent As RoutedEvent

however, handlers of the mouse-button specific events must be added by explicitly calling , with the option to handle events that are already marked as handled, in order to be listeners to the event. 从概念上讲，将此事件 (和其他鼠标事件) 为鼠标"服务"(使用提供的服务定义类)。Conceptually, think of this event (and other mouse-button events on ) to be a mouse "service" (with the service definition provided by the class). 事件添加了方便的不需要检查原始的鼠标事件在事件数据中的鼠标按钮状态 （左-右、 向上向下）。The event adds the convenience of not needing to check the mouse button states (left-right, up-down) of the original mouse events in the event data. 对于更高级的方案，例如非标准按钮的状态检查，您可能需要使用[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)]上而不是这些类上。For more advanced scenarios, such as checking for states of non-standard buttons, you might need to use the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)] on the class rather than those on . 右侧的按钮的鼠标事件中经常会有本机处理应用程序方案。Right button mouse events frequently have native handling in application scenarios. 例如，鼠标左键按下的可能会显示上下文菜单。For instance, a right mouse button down might display a context menu. 请参阅[ContextMenu 概述](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/contextmenu-overview.md)。See [ContextMenu Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/contextmenu-overview.md). ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|直接Direct| |委托Delegate|| - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

span.span: Occurs when the user rotates the mouse wheel while the mouse pointer is over this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 焦点或鼠标捕获优先于在鼠标指针位于其中;因此，如果你收到从已设定焦点或捕获的元素的事件，鼠标指针可能实际上是另一个元素上。Focus or mouse capture take precedence over where the mouse pointer is; therefore, if you receive the event from a focused or captured element, the mouse pointer might actually be over another element. 此事件创建一个别名附加事件对于此类，以便属于类的成员列出时作为基元素继承。This event creates an alias for the attached event for this class, so that is part of the class members list when is inherited as a base element. 事件处理程序附加到事件附加到基础附加事件，并接收相同的事件数据实例。Event handlers that are attached to the event are attached to the underlying attached event and receive the same event data instance. ## 路由事件信息Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |标识符字段Identifier field|| |路由策略Routing strategy|浮升Bubbling| |委托Delegate|| - 相应的隧道事件是。The corresponding tunneling event is . - 重写实现类处理此事件在派生类中。Override to implement class handling for this event in derived classes.

summary.span: 标识 路由事件。

span.span: Identifies the routed event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在注册路由事件时创建路由事件标识符。Routed event identifiers are created when routed events are registered. 这些标识符包含标识名称、所有者类型、处理程序类型、路由策略和、添加事件所有者的实用程序方法。These identifiers contain an identifying name, owner type, handler type, routing strategy, and utility method for adding owners for the event. 可以使用这些标识符添加类处理程序。You can use these identifiers to add class handlers. 有关注册路由的事件的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about registering routed events, see . 有关使用路由事件标识符添加类处理程序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about using routed event identifiers to add class handlers, see .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool MoveFocus(class System.Windows.Input.TraversalRequest request) cil managed
Public Overridable Function MoveFocus (request As TraversalRequest) As Boolean
abstract member MoveFocus : System.Windows.Input.TraversalRequest -> bool override this.MoveFocus : System.Windows.Input.TraversalRequest -> bool

param.name: request
param.span: 一个遍历请求，其中包含一个属性，指示是在现有 tab 键顺序或一个方向移动以可视方式遍历的模式。

span.span: A traversal request, which contains a property that indicates either a mode to traverse in existing tab order, or a direction to move visually.

summary.span: 尝试将焦点从此元素移到另一个元素。

span.span: Attempts to move focus from this element to another element.

summary.span: 要将焦点移动的方向由指导方向，解释此元素的可视父级组织内指定。

span.span: The direction to move focus is specified by a guidance direction, which is interpreted within the organization of the visual parent for this element.

returns.span: 如果执行了请求的遍历;否则为。

span.span: if the requested traversal was performed; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请务必检查此方法的返回值。Make sure you check the return value of this method. 返回值为`false`如果遍历遇到控件的组合所定义的制表位并且遍历请求未请求来包装可能会返回。A return value of `false` might be returned if the traversal runs into a tab stop that is defined by a control's composition, and the traversal request did not request to wrap.

summary.span: 返回类特定于实现[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]基础结构。

span.span: Returns class-specific implementations for the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure.

returns.span: 特定于类型的 实现。

span.span: The type-specific implementation.

remarks.format: ## 继承者说明Notes to inheritors 此方法的实现通常是调用特定构造函数实现中，并将其返回作为返回值。The implementation of this method is typically to call the constructor of a specific implementation, and return it as the return value. 所有派生的类应实现此方法以提供其自己特定于WPF 基础结构的实现。All derived classes should implement this method in order to provide their own specific implementations to the WPF infrastructure. 有关实现此模式的详细信息，请参阅。For details on implementing this pattern, see .

span.span: The that contains the event data.

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

param.name: e

span.span: A that contains event data.

param.span: 此事件数据必须包含 事件的标识符。

span.span: This event data must contain the identifier for the event.

summary.span: 使用所提供的事件数据引发 路由事件。

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。The implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event. ## 继承者说明Notes to inheritors 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation. 否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element. 如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到`false`。If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to `false`. 请注意，默认情况下不是可获得焦点，因此设置有意不可能有必要。Note that by default a is not focusable, therefore setting deliberately might not be necessary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法具有默认实现。The method has no default implementation. 重写中派生的类来处理事件。Override in a derived class to handle the event. 请务必调用基类的方法，从而基本类接收事件。Be sure to call the base class' method so that base classes receive the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此虚方法引发时的值依赖关系属性更改。This virtual method is raised when the value of the dependency property changes. 虚拟方法首先引发，并可以处理在必要时的事件数据。The virtual method is raised first and can manipulate the event data as necessary. 然后与该相同的事件数据实例引发事件。Then the event is raised with that same event data instance. 请注意，事件不是路由的事件。Notice that the event is not a routed event. 因此，您不能将其标记为已处理的类处理程序中。Therefore, you cannot mark it as handled in the class handler. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements.

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 击键通过专用的输入管理器进行处理。Keystrokes are handled by a dedicated input manager. 其他编程功能，依赖于击键，例如，输入和命令绑定，可能会在键击公开为常规击键之前处理。Other programming features that rely on keystrokes, for example, input and command bindings, might handle the keystroke before it is exposed as a general keystroke. 如果这些输入系统功能将事件标记为已处理，然后不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, then is not invoked. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

param.name: e

span.span: A that contains event data.

param.span: 此事件数据必须包含 事件的标识符。

span.span: This event data must contain the identifier for the event.

summary.span: 使用提供的事件数据引发 路由事件。

span.span: Raises the routed event by using the event data that is provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法，尽管虚拟的但有一个默认实现，引发事件。This method, although virtual, does have a default implementation that raises the event. 这在 \* 方法实现用于引发事件，并在内部调用此方法的实现来引发事件时属性值发生更改。This On\* method implementation is intended to raise the event, and this same method implementation is invoked internally to raise the event when the property value changes. 此实现不同于其他某些[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)]上 \* 实现，后者仅提供了方便地为该事件添加类处理。This implementation differs from some other [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] On\* implementations, which only provide a convenient way to add class handling for that event.

para.span: 除非你有有意或不寻常的需求不引发焦点事件，请确保您的实现将调用基实现。

span.span: Unless you have a deliberate and unusual need to not raise the focus events, make sure that your implementation calls the base implementation.

para.span: 否则为通常将焦点设置到此元素的典型用户操作中不引发事件。

span.span: Otherwise, the event is not raised during typical user operations that ordinarily set focus to this element.

para.span: 如果不想您可获得焦点的元素，您可以通过将阻止元素到。

span.span: If you do not intend your element to be focusable, you can prevent the element from being focusable by setting to .

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 您可以调用基之前或之后应用特殊处理，具体取决于您的要求。You may call base either before or after your special handling, depending on your requirements. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件，具有直接的路由策略。In this case the matching event is a routed event, with a direct routing strategy. 将事件标记为已处理是仍有助于防止典型实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。Marking the event as handled is still useful for preventing the typical instance handlers (those that do not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked.

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 看起来进行浮升路由事件，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是基础事件是冒泡路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 看起来进行浮升路由事件，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a bubbling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是基础事件是冒泡路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is bubble routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写但是，而无需调用基实现; 在派生类中此替代禁用上下文菜单上的服务控件，都是一部分的默认行为。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling base; however, this override disables the context menu services on your control, which are part of the default behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events might be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着类处理负责操作的所有可能的鼠标按钮。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button up actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

param.name: e

span.span: The that contains the event data.

param.span: 事件数据报告称已按下一个或多个鼠标按钮。

summary.span: 当某个未处理的 附加路由事件在其路由中到达派生自此类的某个元素时调用。

span.span: Invoked when an unhandled attached routed event reaches an element in its route that is derived from this class.

summary.span: 实现此方法可为此事件添加类处理。

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 处理鼠标按钮操作也是通过专用的输入管理器。Mouse button actions are also handled by a dedicated input manager. 公开为常规鼠标按钮操作之前，其他编程功能，依赖于鼠标按钮操作，例如输入和命令绑定，可能会调用处理程序的操作。Other programming features that rely on mouse button actions, such as input and command bindings, might invoke handlers for the action before it is exposed as a general mouse button action. 如果这些输入系统功能标记事件处理，如不调用。If these input system features mark the event as handled, is not invoked. 如果使用此类处理程序将事件标记为已处理，则可能会影响以下事件：和。If you use this class handler to mark the event as handled, you potentially impact the following events: and . 上述任一事件可能会在接收元素上引发时收到。Either of these events may be raised on the receiving element when is received. 如果标记为已处理的类中处理此事件，则仍会引发子事件;但是，它们通过中的事件数据的处理的状态。If you mark this event as handled in class handling, subevents are still raised; however, they pass the handled state in the event data. 除非您显式使用类处理在处理该事件时，如果不调用为子事件的实例处理与`handledEventsToo``true`才能附加处理程序。If the event is handled in class handling, instance handlers for the subevents are not invoked unless you explicitly use with `handledEventsToo` `true` in order to attach handlers. 类处理程序也不会调用与注册了这些类处理程序，除非带签名`handledEventsToo` `true`。Class handlers also are not invoked unless those class handlers were registered with the signature with `handledEventsToo` `true`. 通过处理，则意味着你类处理负责所有可能的鼠标按钮按下操作。By handling , you are implying that your class handling accounted for all possible mouse button down actions. 此行为可能不需要;因此，此虚拟方法用于将事件标记为已处理时要格外小心。This behavior might be unwanted; Therefore, use caution when you use this virtual method to mark events as handled. 每个特定于按钮的直接事件也有一个虚拟 On \* 方法;请考虑是否重写这些特定于按钮的类处理程序可能会更合适。Each of the button-specific direct events also has a virtual On\* method; consider whether overriding these button-specific class handlers might be more appropriate. 此方法具有默认实现。This method has no default implementation. 因为中间类继承中的可能会实现此方法，我们建议在实现中调用基实现。Because an intermediate class in the inheritance might implement this method, we recommend that you call the base implementation in your implementation. 此方法的用途是类似于[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)]事件模式 On \* 方法： 此方法提供了通过建立类处理程序而不是实例处理程序来处理从派生类的匹配事件的方法。The purpose of this method is similar to the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] event pattern On\* methods: this method provides the means to handle the matching event from derived classes by establishing a class handler instead of an instance handler. 在这种情况下匹配事件是路由的事件。In this case the matching event is a routed event. On \* 方法的实现模式是不同的路由事件，因为可以由子元素，它不一定是将调用处理程序的元素引发路由的事件。The implementation pattern of the On\* methods is different for routed events because a routed event can be raised by a child element, which is not necessarily the element that will invoke handlers. 因此，您的实现需要检查的事件数据源属性。Therefore, your implementation needs to examine the source properties of the event data. 它不应尝试再次引发该事件在大多数情况下。It should not try to reraise the event in most cases. 通过重写此方法或通过注册类处理程序替换，派生类的为由事件路由收到事件时，可以调用私有类处理程序方法。Either by overriding this method or by registering class handlers with , derived classes of can call private class handler methods when the event is received along the event route. 类处理是相应的一种方案是操作事件数据并将路由的事件标记为已处理。One scenario where class handling is appropriate is to manipulate the event data and mark the routed event as handled. 专用于预览事件的另一个方案是将已处理，以便匹配冒泡类处理程序不会调用其标记。Another scenario that is specifically for Preview events is to mark them handled so that the matching bubbling class handlers are not invoked.

span.span: Implement this method to add class handling for this event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding . 或者，可以以更改的事件处理特定的鼠标状态来重写此方法。Alternatively, you can override this method in order to change event handling for a specific mouse state. 您是否选择调用基实现取决于你的方案。Whether you choose to call the base implementation depends on your scenario. 未能调用基禁用默认为基实现，也应调用该鼠标事件的输入的处理。Failing to call base disables default input handling for that mouse event on ancestor classes that also expect to invoke . 例如，您可以从其中并重写在派生类而不会调用基实现; 但是，此重写禁用事件。For example, you can derive from and override in your derived class without calling the base implementation; however, this override disables the event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected internal virtual void OnPreviewMouseLeftButtonUp (System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs e);

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件看起来进行隧道路由，但实际上是以间接方式。The event appears to travel a tunneling route but actually travels in an indirect way. 是的基础事件是隧道路由，并且每个沿着事件路由使用相同的处理引发的直接路由的事件。 is the underlying event that is tunnel routed, and each along the event route uses identical handling to raise the direct routed event . 尽管可以将标记为此元素的已处理的事件，处理的状态不会不保留到其他元素为由事件路由。Although you can mark the event as handled for purposes of this element, the handled state does not perpetuate to other elements along the event route. 但是，你可能想要将事件标记为已处理以防止常规实例处理程序 (未指定的那些`handledEventsToo`) 调用。However, you might want to mark the event as handled in order to prevent general instance handlers (those that did not specify `handledEventsToo`) from being invoked. 常规鼠标事件处理中的默认实现侦听并将其转换为相应的本地事件。The default implementation for general mouse event handling in listens for and converts it to an appropriate local event. 如果你想要覆盖此逻辑，必须创建派生的类。If you want to override this logic, you must create a derived class. 在派生类的静态构造函数，将注册的替代类处理程序。In the static constructor of your derived class, register an alternative class handler for . 不能更改处理行为的鼠标通过重写。You cannot change the mouse handling behavior of by overriding .
